alert.note: Alert for Calumet; Manitowoc; Winnebago (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 26 at 6:40AM CDT by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Calumet, Winnebago and Manitowoc Counties through 800 AM CDT... At 639 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 9 miles east of Fremont to near Oshkosh to near Fall River. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Menasha and Central Lake Winnebago around 655 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Appleton, Chilton, High Cliff State Park, St Anna, Camp Rokilio Scout Camp, Brillion, St. Nazianz and Cleveland. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until these storms pass.
